intro: [WRONG START] Aesculus hippocastum var. pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramid horse chestnut, is a cultivar of the horse chestnut tree characterized by its narrow, pyramidal shape. It features large, palmately compound leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces showy, red-orange flower clusters in the spring, which are followed by spiny, capsule-like fruits containing bright red seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and parks. This variety is relatively disease-resistant and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
